title: Observing How the Universe Changed over Time

previous.title: Observing How the Universe Changed over Time

content: If you look at the map for the most recent times, you will notice that there are some areas that have a very low concentration of galaxies. Areas of very low galaxy concentrations are referred to as voids.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Will the number of galaxies in the regions we call voids be increasing or decreasing with time?  Explain why this would be happening based on what you know about gravity and matter.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: The total amount of matter of the Universe does not change over time. Explain how this applies to the changes in the size of voids and concentrations of galaxies over time.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Is the large-scale structure changing in the same way, in all directions, over time?
